title: Mathematical Olympiads 1998 -1999: Problems and Solutions from Around the World (MAA Problem Book Series)
features: This volume contains a large range of problems, with and without solutions, taken from 25 national and regional mathematics olympiads from around the world, and the problems are drawn from several years' contests. In many cases, more than one solution is given to a single problem in order to highlight different problem-solving strategies. The collection is intended as practice for students preparing for these competitions. Teachers and general readers looking for interesting problems will find also it very useful.
description: ...invaluable to anyone involved in training national mathematics teams or simply interested in challenging problems from elementary mathematics. --
Hats off to Andreescu and Feng for putting together this interesting collection of the best from around the world. --
This is a wonderful book for puzzle lovers...it belongs in the hands of everyone interested in National Mathematics Contests. --
A large range of problems drawn from mathematics olympiads from around the world.
